dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're going to catch him on a trace?  Everything he does is planned out well in advance.  The only way we're going to get him is to rattle him -- make him slip up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know how you're going to catch a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's right, Captain.  He's got to be forced into making a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't ask for your opinion, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stares at Andy defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't tell us how to run our investigation.  You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have an investigation without me.  You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men lock eyes hostilely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you going to say, Kathy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you have to play to his ego.  He thinks he's superior.  The more secure he feels, the more chances he'll take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he mean by Huxley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was referring to a quote by Thomas Henry Huxley. (quoting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The chess board is the world, the pieces are the phenomena of the universe, the rules of the game are what we call Nature.  The player on the other side is hidden from us.  We know that his play is always fair, just, and patient.  But also, we know, to our cost, that he never overlooks a mistake, or makes the smallest allowances for ignorance."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Kathy are sitting on the beach.  Peter draws sq in the sand like a chessboard and starts moving shells an rocks around.  Kathy grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you playing chess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter smiles like a boy with his hand caught in the cooki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little I'd watch the other kids playing baseball from my room.  In the evening, when their parents would call them in to put their bats and balls away, I'd watch them from my window, forcing, expressions of disappointment, trying to gain another few minutes outside so they could play -- but no one could stop me from playing. (he closes his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I had to do was close my eyes and my whole world became a chessboard.  I could see the pieces, and sometimes it felt like if I reached out I could almost touch them.  I ordered them and they obeyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stares at him for a moment, unsure what to make of speech.  Peter opens his eyes, there is a beat as he seem bridge the gap back to this world.  He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you go fifteen minutes without thinking about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks for a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But I'm open to distractions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her.  He destroys the pattern in the sand, t her hand and they start walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're not the easiest person in the world to get close to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always want to talk about me.  What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't I just talking about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You were talking about chess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.  Where's Erica mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died in a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.  It was a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must've been very hard on Erica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stops and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to lay down, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, why don't you just come out and ask me what you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it serious between Debi and me? No.  Have I known a lot of girls like her? (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stares at him, almost studying him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you noticed that every time we start to talk about something serious you start to play games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playing a game now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are.  You're playing word games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to get to know you, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  By attacking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody could attack you.  You set your life up like one of your chessboards. You're impregnable -- but at the same time you've become trapped behind your own defenses.  You're cut off from everyone around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  You don't even know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you forfeiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops dead in his tracks, turns and walks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want to fight with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then show me who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter thinks.  There's a seriousness we haven't seen befo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This frightens me -- because I'm starting to feel things I haven't felt in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to face the things you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were the woman who didn't want to get involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I didn't plan on getting involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves closer.  She takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to facing the things we feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can turn everything around so easily.  This is not just another game, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other, each of them probing the others Peter leans forward and gently kisses her on the lips.  H kisses her again.  Their passion builds until they throw arms around each other and embrace passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pins her against the wall and kisses her.  She wrap legs around his waist as he holds her against the wall. continue to kiss as they move along the wall, knocking pi off the wall.  Peter carries her over to a LARGE CHESSBOA With one hand he sweeps the PIECES off onto the floor, th sits her down on it.  They kiss each other furiously, eac them groping at the others clothing.  Their hands move al each others bodies, exploring, touching, feeling.  He un- buttons her blouse, then kisses her neck, working his way her breasts.  Kathy closes her eyes, submitting to the pl of his touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SILHOUETTES.  Bodies intertwined.  The SOUNDS of love making fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call room service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIGHT COMES on.  Kathy lays next to Peter.  She rolls o and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate hotel food.  Rondi's Pizza is just down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nibbling at her neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you settle for pepperoni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I have to.  I'm going to take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter goes into the bathroom.  Kathy sits up and throws o shirt.  She goes to the desk.  By the phone is a copy of WHITE PAGES.  She starts to look up the number.  In b.g. HEAR the SHOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PHONE BOOK:  In the middle of the page a name is underlined in RED.  It reads:  RUTLEGE, DEBI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stares at the name.  A beat.  Slowly she turns thro the pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PHONE BOOK:  The name EASTMAN, CHRISTIE is UNDER The pages are quickly turned again until we see the name LORAINE UNDERLINED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy is stunned.  She thinks for a second, then gets up starts getting dressed.  In the b.g. we HEAR the SHOWER s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line was busy.  I'll try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes dressing then heads for the door.  She opens door and stops, then looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV: Her PURSE is on the nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates, then quickly walks back to get it.  She pi up and starts back for the door when... Peter steps out o bathroom.  He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not delivering.  I'm going to go pick up the pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving closer to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said the line was busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried again and got through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you backing up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter waits for an answer.  There isn't one.  He looks ar the room, retracing in his mind what could have happened. sees the open PHONE BOOK on the dresser next to him.  He at it for a moment, then back at Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.  Peter appears disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was looking for correlations between their names, addresses, anything that might be the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're as bad as Andy... maybe worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to a chair and sits down, freeing the path door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, you have to admit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --admit what?  That I was right about you in the steam room?  That you're willing to do anything to find out what you want?  Would you like me to leave so you can search the rest of the room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off; hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you think that, Kathy?  How could you even consider it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Kathy thinks for a moment, then walks to the doo leaves.  A beat.  Peter gets up, stares at the phone book closes it softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter seems deep in thought.  Behind him Lutz is pacing b and forth.  He is wearing a ridiculous hat with sheets of aluminium foil sticking out.  Peter stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're trying to control my mind. (points to his hat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aluminium foil.  It repels the thought rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter stares at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy enters her house and checks her messages.  There ar none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks out on stage.  Yurilivich is waiting for him CHESSBOARD.  The other two tables are vacant_  The Presid addresses the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since Grandmaster Sanderson leads the tournament with nine wins,  and Grandmaster Yurilivich is in second with eight -- it as become apparent that with only four games remaining, the other players, should they win all four of their remaining games, would still not be in a position to win the tournament.  Therefore, we have decided that the remaining games between Grandmaster Sanderson and Yurilivich will be held separately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits on the couch, reading a book entitled: CASE ST OF SERIAL KILLRS.  She appears distracted.  She looks off thinks about Peter.  Finally, she grabs her coat and leav house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yurilivich makes a moves, then hits his timer.  The PIECE on the board behind them.

dialogues.text: Jeremy grabs Erica's arm excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mate in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter makes a move.  There is a slight MOAN from the crow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy looks at the BIG BOARD reflecting Peter's move the at Erica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yurilivich makes a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is stunned at his position.  He looks at the board, frustration fills his face.  Slowly he picks up his KING lays it on his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door to the auditorium we see Kathy watching him. turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired-looking Peter walks to his door.  He starts to pu his key when he notices the door is ajar.  A beat.  He sl pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Peter enters.  He tries the light switch.  It does work.  He walks slowly across the room.  As he nears the FIGURE OF A MAN stands up out of one of the high-backed c Peter senses something and spins around.  A LIGHT on the comes on.  Andy stares at him with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scare you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter doesn't answer.  He stares at Andy hostilely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I figure that's pretty much how these girl's feel just before they get it.  You think I'm right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  I guess only the killer would know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it was.  Otherwise I'd be breaking and entering.  That's a felony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever do any hunting, Peter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to.  With my old man.  He taught me how to hunt and trap.  Trapping's a lot harder than most people think.  We used to go after Raccoons mostly. They'd get into our garbage, our fields.  When an animal can't live peacefully with those around it, it has to be destroyed.  But they're crafty little devils.  You see the trick is, you can put your trap down, but no Raccoon is going come near it unless you lay down the scent.  You ever smell Raccoon scent?  Smells like shit, but to a male Raccoon it smells just like pussy.  He'll walk right up to that trap, even though it don't look nothing like a Raccoon and stick his Goddam head right in it.  You know why?  Cause he can't help himself.  The scent drives him.  So, if you want to catch a Raccoon all you gotta do is figure out where he is -- lay down the scent -- and sooner or later he'll walk right into the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't bite?  What if he's an exceptionally bright Raccoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, you just gotta find out where he is -- and once you're sure where he is -- you shoot the fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  They stare at each other.  Andy walks to the doo leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sits outside, thinking.  Jeremy and Erica join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him.  He hugs her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just got lucky tonight, that's all. You'll cream him next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter smiles.  There is a long pause.  Peter looks at Jer They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something you want to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just thought you might want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever's on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says something's on my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy pulls out a printout of chess board with pieces in different positions.  He shows it to Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mate in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly... and you did this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy moves an imaginary piece.  Peter stares at the pap a moment.  He can't believe he could miss such an obvious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Kathy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Kathy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy stares at him with a knowing expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Kathy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, I know you better than you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the BLACK we hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Kathy??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!  As we see the word IS  written in blood on a wall HEAR the SOUND of a POLAROID CAMERA pushing out the photo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!  We see a new GIRL laying in her bed, the sheet dr over her body, her face made up.  DARKNESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!  A CLOSE UP of the girl's ghastly face.  DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON:  GLOVED HANDS as they pull a photo from the cam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the apartment LIGHTS are out.  We see SEVERAL FLASHES LIGHT from an upstairs window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy walks up a dirt path towards the side of the buildi She comes to a depression in the earth.  She stops, lifts skirt, as she gets ready to jump over, when something cat her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HER POV:  in the soft ground she sees A perfect imprint o Killer's distinctive tennis shoe_

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stares at it as the thought that the killer is near becomes more frightening.  She starts to back up slowly w She bumps into Dr. Fulton behind her.  She SCREAMS, then around quickly.  Fulton is startled at her action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Alan, you scared the crap outta me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several BLACK AND WHITE UNITS are in front of the buildin Frank and Andy are off to the side talking to an ATTRACTI GIRL in her twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can think of anything else give us a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I hate to say I told you so, but I warned her.  Coming home at all hours of the night.  A young girl new to the city.  This neighborhood ain't what it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UNIFORMED OFFICER standing by a BLACK and WHITE UNIT ye over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, you got a call!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PHOTOGRAPH:  OF THE KILLER'S SHOE:  Pull back to another PHOTOGRAPH just like it on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distraught Kathy sits on a chair, sipping a cup of coff with both hands.  Frank and Andy stand up waiting for Nol appraisal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same shoe alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anyone else on the grounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone stand out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, stand out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did anyone look suspicious?  Think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that you mention it there was somebody who looked suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was suspicious about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was holding a sign that said "Serial Killer".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank LAUGHS.  Andy does a slow burn, then smiles.  Throu GLASS WINDOW Frank sees the GIRL from the apartment walki down the hall.  He thinks about something for a moment, t springs from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... you said earlier that Mary Albert just moved in.  How long ago was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how she found the apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you tell me that Debi Rutlege had just moved into her place also?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy is standing off to the side, listening to Frank and as they both speak on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh...  Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, looks at Frank and NODS with a grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I really appreciate it.  Thanks. (he hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it!  All the women moved into their homes in the last three months and all of them found them through Homesearchers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UNMARKED CAR is parked down the street from HOMESEARCH Frank and Andy get out and walk towards a building with T DETECTIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MIDDLE AGED WOMAN stands behind the counter. She stares Frank with a bewildered expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else works here beside you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a girl that helps at the counter, part time and that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else has access to these files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK on the door.  Erica opens it to find Kat outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Erica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your dad here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went down to the lobby for a minute. He should be right back.  Would you like come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy enters and sits on the couch.  Erica sits beside he stares at her, evaluating her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you having a good time on the Island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  It's pretty boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's only because you don't know where to go.  You like hiking? (Erica nods no)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishing? (Erica nods no)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailing? (Erica nods no)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy grins and they LAUGH together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... do you mean do I like, like him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica waits expectantly.  Kathy grins, but doesn't answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he really likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?  Did he say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... but I can tell.  A woman knows these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy smiles.  She looks up and sees Peter standing in th doorway.  There is a moment of embarrassment between them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, why don't you run down to Jeremy's now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Kathy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over to Peter and gives him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like her.  She's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica leaves.  There is an uncomfortable moment between P and Kathy.  They look at each other, probing each others There is a KNOCK on the door.  Frank and Andy enter, thei expressions are serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one? (Frank nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What word did he leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Is". (to Kathy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him about the institute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is on the phone with the Caller.  Kathy sits beside Frank and Andy are with the Technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you any idea what the message is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's so important, why don't you just tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell you that.  It would ruin the game.  Not that you're playing it very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to brag, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credit should be given where it's due. I'm not worldly like you, Peter.  I'm not an internationally known figure. I'm just a poor guy who has never been anywhere, but I'm beating you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caller's statement hits home.  Slowly a look of determination covers Peter's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why were you looking for Doctor Sheppard today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.  Why did you go out to the institute looking for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think I was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (using his words)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell you that.  It would ruin the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game's almost over, Peter, and you're running out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's face hardens, eyes intensely staring off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you who's running out of time. You're starting to make mistakes now. You're wondering just how much I really know.  Just how close I'm getting? Well, I'm closer than you think, pal -- and I'm gonna nail your ass to the wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice speech, Peter.  Did you rehearse that, or was it impromptu? (Peter doesn't answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an old wooden bench in the garden.  Next to it is a rock.  You'll find a message for you under it.  Let's see if you're as clever as you think you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead.  Peter hangs up, his frustration show

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sits across the desk from Frank.  Kathy stands by t window.  The room is crowded with the Caller's clues.  Th with colored pins in it.  The words:  REMEMBER EVENTUALLY REVENGE IS...  A copy of the Caller's NOTE written on the blackboard.  It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks over to the BLACKBOARD and studies the note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a fierce magazine you'll find a hint of my actions to come... Why does he set this line apart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For emphasis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  It's the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what does he mean by a fierce magazine?  Violent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fierce magazine... brutal... (thinking aloud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angry magazine... A war magazine... a mercenary magazine...  fierce... (he gets it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the note?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need the original note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a photostat of the original on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter gets up and takes the note off the wall and studies for a moment, then starts to fold it in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter reads Mad Magazine all the time.  If you fold the back cover a certain way, the text reads differently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter moves the crease of the paper in and out until it f the correct margin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOTE now reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy looks at Peter, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As large as castles.  You are still light as air, one hundred men can't move me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make sense because we don't understand it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a hundred men could move him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing patience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not talking about himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on edge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we knew that we'd know the answer to the riddle, wouldn't we?  He's telling us where he's going to kill tonight and we can't see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should back up a minute and take a look at what we do have.  All the girls that have been killed have been killed at night.  They're all the same type.  All moved into their homes within the last three months -- and all of them found their homes through Homesearchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that Homesearchers was a dead end?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be a coincidence.  The woman that owns it has a son.  She says he's been on vacation in Montana for the last ten days.  We're trying to locate him.  There's also a cleaning service that comes in once a week.  We're checking that out too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves around a lot.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds his victims through Homesearchers.  He goes where they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is only half-listening to the conversation.  He app deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they rent lots of apartments.  He could probably find them all in a localized area.  Why move all over the Island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter slowly comes to a realization.  His eyes open wide thought crashes into his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  It can't be that easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks to the MAP of the victims locations on the wa He moves his finger from point to point, examining each location.  Kathy, Frank and Andy watch him.  Peter contin move his finger in various GEOMETRIC LINES across the map

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to tell us what the hell you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter doesn't answer.  He stares at the MAP for a few mor seconds, as the excitement of his realization grows.  He a step back and turns to Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told us and we missed it!  He said he's never been anywhere.  Therefore, this Island is the world to him. (pointing to the map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as he's concerned, this is a map of the world.  That's why he quoted Huxley.  "The chessboard is the world."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter takes a MARKS-O-LOT off Kathy's desk and DRAWS a LA SQUARE BORDER on the MAP, OUTLINING THE GRIDS, EIGHT BY E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's using the map as a chessboard! The sonofabitch is playing chess with me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he be playing Chess with you? You're not making any moves against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter rushes towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is with Kathy, Frank, Andy and David at the compute station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get into the Federation records?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  We've got a modem line hooked up with the data base in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we correlate data?  Look for specific things, like player's ages... stuff like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. (hits a few buttons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Run a search to see if there are any players with a rating above two thousand that live on the Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters the commands on the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set up some pieces on the big board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't see how he could be playing chess against you.  There's only enough grids on the map to be half a board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all he needs.  He's making the moves.  It's an opening.  I just can't remember the name. (looks at the board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's a game.  He's starting it, so he moves first.  He's white.  e2-e4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pieces on the board move, following Peter's instructi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D2-d4...  b1-c3... and c1-f4. (he studies the board)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the number two variation of the Tarakoss opening. (thinks for a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, can you bring up the tournament records for the last ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Sanderson, they'll be hundreds of thousands of games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're only interested in people who have played against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters the data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have computer search for anyone that's used that opening against me.  There can't be more than a handful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters the information and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's three.  The first is 1983. Lionel Baines.  The Boston...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  He died two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1985.  Hans Korshaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in his seventies and lives in Holland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David presses a button and looks at the next one.  He hes and looks at Peter awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; hesitantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York.  1986.  Viktor Yurilivich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet rage spreads across Peter's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Print out the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Kathy, and  all stand around a map of the Island. looks at a PRINTOUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's replaying the game I played against him move by move, using these girls as the Chess pieces. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls have been found in their homes except Christie Eastman, who was found in back of a warehouse.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making the connection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because to follow the game he played he had to move to that grid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (he searches the map and points to a spot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!  c-4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a commercial area.  No one lives there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he had to dump the body there to make the move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that you know what stage of the game he's at, can we figure out where his next move is going to be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks over to the MAP and traces his finger over it looks at the computer printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His last move was c1-f4.  I would move f8-g7.  His next move using the Tarakoss would be... e2-e3... that would be... (points to a spot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment of silence as Kathy, Frank and Andy bot digest what they have heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of those grids represents almost a square mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big area to cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's narrow it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knowingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homesearchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy stands at the desk with the WOMAN they talked to bef He holds out a THOMAS GUIDE and places it on the desk nex the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to feed every street in this grid into your computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take hours.  You can't make me do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, I can't make you do it. Besides, you're probably gonna be too busy with the Franchise Tax Board anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta friend over there.  He was telling me things are kind of slow. So, I figured I'd give him a call, have him come down here and look through your records.  You know, give him something to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the first street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PULLS BACK through the window until we are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Kathy and Frank stand on the sidewalk.  Peter look the NOTE and folds it to read the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As large as castles, you are still light as the air, one hundred men can't move me.  It's posed as a question. What am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A building isn't as light as air. What's large, but as light as air and can't be moved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As large as castles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Why not just say a building if he meant any general type of structure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going to give us direct hints. He's going to skirt around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses castles...plural --  then says "can't move me."  Singular.  Not can't move us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stretches her arms above her head.  Her shadow fall across the lawn.  Peter stares at the ground for a moment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow.  What's as big a castle?  As light as air , but one hundred men can't move it?  The shadow of the castle.  Are there any buildings that have the name Castle in it that cast a shadow long enough to fall across another building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  There's an apartment in that area called the Castle Arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's got to be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter rushes inside Homesearchers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands Andy and SIX DETECTIVES.  One of them is a W named JANET MCLELLAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Homesearchers gave us the name Laura Owens.  She just moved into an apartment across the street from the Castle Arms one week ago.  We've moved her to her parents house in Seattle and S.P.D. is going to keep a watch on her tonight. (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer McLellan will spend the night at her apartment. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, you're going to go to the hotel and pick up Yurilivich at the tournament.  Stay with him until it ends, then follow him wherever he goes. If things work out right we'll wrap this up tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks out on stage to join Yurilivich who is alread seated.  Peter stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is standing over a bed.  Officer McLellan is under covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McLellan pulls down the blanket to reveal her .38 and nod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank joins a DETECTIVE and begins to wait in the darknes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game continues.  Peter makes a move.  Andy watches th from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OUTLINE of SOMEONE walks down the street, then stops f moment.  Under s STREET LAMP we see that it's a WOMAN in fifties walking her dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yurilivich makes a move, then hits his timer.  Peter stud the board.  He looks up at Yurilivich.  Both of them star each other intensely.  Peter looks back at the board and a move.  On the BIG BOARD a PIECE MOVES, then STOPS halfw between a square.  A moment later the entire board breaks into an unreadable mass of lines.  There's a GROAN from t crowd.  The President walks over to David and confers wit quickly, then goes to the players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The board's going to take several hours to repair.  I think we should adjourn until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV of someone walking slowly along the side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer McLellan stirs in bed, the tension of waiting beg to take affect on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV of someone looking through a bedroom window and l inside.  We can see the outline of a WOMAN in bed.  Slowl window is open by TWO GLOVED HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POV climbs through the window and studies the WOMAN i for a moment.  She is on her SIDE, her back to him.  Sens something the WOMAN turns over.  THE WOMAN IS NOT OFFICER MCLELLAN!  Her eyes widen with terror... then FLASH!  BRI LIGHT fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks impatient.  He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a bad feeling about this. If Yurilivich was making a move we would have heard something from Andy by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we're in the wrong place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has to be the right place.  It all fits.  This is the only building that has the word castle in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  There's the Castle Courts Apartments over on Pine Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's all the way across town. It's in another grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank thinks for a moment, then checks his watch again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hold things down here.  I'm going to take a run over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bracket-shaped, one story building in a less expensive of town.  Frank drives up in his car and gets out.  He st to walk towards the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK'S POV:  From a window in the back we see a series o FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grabs his radio microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sedman.  It's going down in the back apartment of the Castle Courts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs towards the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door crashes open as Frank breaks it down.  He the room, his .38 readied.  We MOVE with him as he works way towards the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slowly moves towards the bedroom.  He stops at the takes a deep breath, then lunges in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters.  The room is lit by moonlight.  The rear wi is open.  On the bed is the WOMAN we saw earlier.  She is naked.  Her arms tied to the bed frame.  There are two de GASHES in her wrists.  Blood flows from her wrists into l plastic bags.  Her mouth is taped.  Still conscious she struggles, her eyes opened wide in a horror-filled stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wall behind her, written in blood is CAREFULLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs to the window.  The b.g. we HEAR the SOUND of FOOTSTEPS running away.  Frank turns back towards the Wom quickly moves to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK and WHITE UNITS are parked in front, their lights flashing.  Frank looks drained as he watches an AMBULANCE away.  He walks over to Andy who is at a POLICE CAR on th RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's unconscious, but they think she's going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen a lot of things in my time on the job, but nothing like this. Yurilivich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was with him the whole time until I got the call at the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanderson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to Jeremy.  He's watching Sanderson's kid.  Sanderson went out after the match and hasn't come back since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find him!  I want to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sits on the beach.  He stares out over the water wi pained expression.  He reaches into his pocket and remove ENVELOPE we saw earlier and stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the DOORBELL.  Kathy glances at her watch as she across the living room to the front door.  She looks thro the viewing-hole, then opens the door to reveal a tired-l Peter on the doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy thinks about it for a moment,then opens the door wi signaling for him to come in.  Kathy sits down on the arm of a chair, Peter stands.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other night -- I said some things that maybe I shouldn't have.  I mean, you haven't known me very long and I can see how you thought what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not looking for an apology, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking that... maybe when this is all over we could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want someone I can get close to. I don't know if that's possible with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really haven't seen my best side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen.  You have no idea of the kind of pressure I'm under right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's still no excuse.  You treat everything like a game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think any more, unless it's about you.  I'll be in the middle of a match and instead of thinking about my next move, I think about how you look when you smile. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember how you said that I hide behind my chessboard?  Ever since my wife died I've been... (this isn't easy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been afraid of getting too close to someone again -- afraid of losing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wife died.  You can't feel responsible for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then help me to understand.  I want to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it isn't.  It's always difficult when someone you love dies. But you can't feel responsible because she had a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she killed herself!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed herself. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drove her car over that cliff! (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the police said it was an accident -- but I knew.  I've always known.  I closed myself off to her and after I found the letter I closed myself off to everything else.  Beating Yurilivich and playing for the title was all I could think about -- but I snapped.  I had a breakdown in the middle of the match.  I don't remember too much about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes the envelope from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This letter.  I've never opened it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know what it says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're afraid of what it says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Peter walks to the couch and sits down.  He star the envelope, then starts to open it.  He stops and looks Kathy who nods her head.  Kathy starts to leave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stay with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits beside him.  He opens the envelope and starts read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter.  There are many pains we feel in this world -- but loving someone who has shut you out of his life has to be the most unbearable of them all.  I knew when we married that you were a man consumed with ambition, but somewhere along the way, your chessboard became your wife, and I became your mistress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know now that you cannot change, cannot give me the things I need.  You may think that I'm a coward for what I am about to do, but it is my choice. My release.  I only ask that you shield Erica from the truth, and that you forgive me for being so weak. Jennifer.

dialogues.text: His eyes fill with tears.  The guilt he has carried for s is released.  Kathy puts her arm around him.  He turns to and rests his head on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- yes... usually we find they've had a traumatic childhood.  He was probably abused by a dominant female figure.  That, coupled with the fact that these girls have not been raped leads me to believe that he is either impudent or a latent homosexual. Regardless, he's acting out some type of revenge fantasy that fulfills some sick sexual needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at the beach.

dialogues.text: You sure you weren't over on Pine Road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lying bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!  I'm tired of your goddam accusations!  If you want to arrest me go ahead!  Otherwise back off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all a big game isn't it?  A sick, fuckin' game.  I don't know if there's two of you involved, or what -- but we're going to find out.  Last night you gave us just enough to send us to the wrong place.  It must've shocked the hell out to you when Frank walked in on Pine Road and you couldn't finish.

dialogues.text: Peter starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off me!

dialogues.text: Andy explodes.  He pushes Peter backward into a GLASS FIR EXTINGUISHER CASE.  It breaks as Peter's HAND SMASHES THR THE GLASS.  Peter raises his hand.  Blood pours out from on his wrist.  Anger floods across his face.  He raises h hand to hit Andy.  Andy quickly pulls out his gun and poi at Peter's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to shoot me?  Go ahead.  Shoot me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Andy lock eyes.  Everyone in the room is stunne Peter's action.  The tension is broken as the phone RINGS Peter and Andy continue to stare at each other.  Slowly, backs off.  Peter doesn't move.  The PHONE continues to R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think that you and I are doing this together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting concept.  I hadn't thought of that.  If you think about how Anton Berger plays chess you might get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to think it doesn't mean anything.  Remember eventually revenge-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you're hopeless!  You can't even read a sentence!  Didn't they teach you punctuation in school?  The game ends tonight!

dialogues.text: Kathy sits with Frank at the table. Andy paces.  Frank an Kathy look at the PHOTOGRAPHS of MESSAGE-WORDS on the wal

dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon.  We're not going to spend any more time on this crap, are we?  It doesn't mean anything.  It's Sanderson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't him.  Frank, you brought me in on this in the beginning because you wanted my opinion if he was capable of doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you're sleeping with the guy. You've lost your perspective.  You can't possibly be unbiased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Kathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you're off the case.

dialogues.text: Kathy looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I have no choice.  I can't run the risk of compromising what little we do know and the future actions of this department by sharing knowledge with someone who is emotionally involved with the prime suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy stands up and stares at Frank angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Andy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if he's wrong.  If you were one hundred percent sure it was Peter you would've arrested him.  If it is someone else then he's going to kill again tonight and you're sitting here ignoring the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to work on the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stinks!  You want to know what I think?  I think there have been five murders and you've got shit to go on. You need to blame someone and he's the easiest choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most logical choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a shred of evidence!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find the evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't find your dick in a wind storm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks through the room.  He bumps into Lutz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Jeremy today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do will you tell him I'm looking for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is sitting on the couch writing on a piece of paper Kathy walks over holding two cups of COFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could just figure out what the next word is going to be.  He said the game's going to end tonight so there's only going to be one more word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got to be grammatically correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter gets up and starts pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember eventually revenge is carefully... carefully what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy looks at Peter with a stunned expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know it was "carefully"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Peter stares at her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  The killer told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't tell you either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Their eyes lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he did.  He said, "think about how Anton Berger plays chess".  Anton Berger wrote one of the most famous books on chess called "Principals and Tactics".  Every beginning player reads it.  The first chapter is his three rules to good play:  Carefully. Carefully.  Carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter looks at her, studying her for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't going to be like the phone book, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.  Kathy checks her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be late for your match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to come tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'll be there later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks over to her and kisses her good-bye.  Kathy f a smile.  Peter walks to the door, opens it, then looks b her, then leavess.  Kathy stares at the door, her mind ra She starts to pace as she thinks, then walks to her phone and looks up a number.  She dials and waits as it rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sara.  This is Doctor Sheppard.  I was wondering if you could tell me if you have a book on chess called "Principals and Tactics" by Anton Berger.

dialogues.text: I can check and call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  I'm at 639-7393.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll call you back.

dialogues.text: Kathy hangs up.  There is a KNOCK on the door.  She walks towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.  I forgot something.

dialogues.text: Kathy hesitates a moment, then opens the door.  Terror fi her face.

Kathy kicks her way free.  She crawls backwards, pushing herself back with her legs.  The MAN crawls after groping for her legs with his GLOVED HANDS.  He grabs her ankle, then sits on top of her, pinning her to the ground SPEAKS IN A WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have said those things about me today.  You have no idea what I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises a STILETTO.  CLICK!  The BLADE just out.  He ho before her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Peter walks out on stage and sits across from Yurilivich. sits down and makes a move, then looks out into the audie

dialogues.text: Frank and Andy drive back towards town.  Frank is on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Kathy sits by the window.  LIGHTNING lights up the night She sips a cup of coffee.  Doctor Fulton stands behind he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to believe it.  It's a normal reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come the police never had a record of Sanderson before.  This doesn't come out of nowhere, there has to be a history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is sitting on a chair, his hands cuffed.  He looks stunned.  Frank and Andy sit before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremy would have never killed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he just got tired of covering for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane!  Can't you see what's going on.  The killer wants me out of the way.  He's setting me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set yourself up tonight when you attacked Kathy, you crazy fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saw the cut on your wrist, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bainbridge Police Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Richard Farrington.  I've been retained by the Chess Federation as council for Peter Sanderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits at Doctor Fulton's desk, staring at the phone. beat.  She picks up the receiver and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bainbridge Books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, this is Doctor Sheppard.  I called you earlier about a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you please do me a big favor?  In the first chapter the author mentions his three rules of chess.  Could you look and tell me what they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. (a long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, here it is. (a little laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, they're all the same?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Carefully".  "Carefully". "Carefully".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is at the door with Officer Harton.  Andy glares at hostilely.  Frank puts a piece of paper on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chess Federation got you an attorney.  Here's his number.  You've got three minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Peter Sanderson calling for Richard Farrington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emotional?  I expected more from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kill tonight and I'm in jail the police will know I'm innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By that time the game will be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've figured out the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you haven't.  And even if you had it doesn't matter.  Who would you tell? The police don't believe you, and you've just used your only phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the Caller LAUGH, then the line goes dead.  Peter his attention to the WORDS.  He springs from his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Peter, think.  The game ends tonight.  He'll leave one more word. Remember eventually revenge is carefully... carefully what?  Planned? Arranged?  Contrived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands with Andy.  Andy checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for round two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a feeling we're going to go the distance with him.  Let him sweat for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy paces the room.  Doctor Fulton is at his desk worki the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy, please.  You're going to wear a hole in the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just nervous.  Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're safe.  He wouldn't come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He already did once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy thinks about something for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did he what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was watching you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- that's what we've always thought -- but what if he wasn't?  What if I had nothing to do with the reason he came here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're losing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he came here because he's a patient.  An out-patient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember eventually... remember eventually... grammar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Period!  That's what he meant about punctuation.  Remember.  Remember what?

dialogues.text: Kathy is at a computer.  Doctor Fulton works at his desk. FILES from the computer MONITOR scroll past, reflecting o Kathy's GLASSES.
